channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Small businesses say Trump tariffs are hurting this group of consumers this holiday season—here’s what is getting more expensive
item.description: Consumers' estimated gift budgets decreased $229 between October and November, according to a Gallup index.

item.title: Mark Cuban Sends Strong Message to Creatives About AI
Stretch fabric is nearly impossible to recycle—but this startup just made it simple
item.description: Stretch fabrics are notoriously hard to process. When your old leggings wear out, they will probably end up in a landfill—even if you try to drop them...

item.title: The Penny Shortage Could Eat Into Your Profit Margin. Meanwhile, Investors Are Spending Millions on Them
item.description: People paid small fortunes for the last one-cent pieces ever minted. Now business owners struggle to give customers correct change as the discontinued...

item.title: Trump vows to fight ‘fraud’ in SNAP benefits for 42 million Americans
item.description: “It's always something that goes wrong,” Jamal Brown, a 41-year-old food stamp participant said, “unfortunately.”

item.title: AI’s $16 trillion problem: It still isn’t working on the factory floor
item.description: In theory, AI should have transformed manufacturing by now. From predictive maintenance and fatigue detection to real-time quality control, the promis...

item.title: Tom Freston’s new memoir shows how a ‘bebop lifestyle’ can lead to success
item.description: Tom Freston could easily fill a book with stories from the formative days of MTV and his celebrity encounters — Bono would merit a few chapters on his...

item.title: New survey reveals this surprising fact about companies that successfully use AI
item.description: A lot has been written about how AI is coming for your job , but EY’s latest AI survey found some surprising results. Out of 500 top executives at maj...

item.title: 7 in 10 Employers Say a College Degree Still Matters
item.description: If you learned AI skills while getting a diploma, you may be in demand at many companies across the country.

item.title: How Connecticut became a hot spot for Hallmark holiday movie fans
item.description: “Christmas at Pemberley Manor” and “Romance at Reindeer Lodge” may never make it to Oscar night, but legions of fans still love these sweet-yet-predic...

item.title: Why Tesla Can’t Catch Waymo, According to a Longtime Investor
item.description: A longtime investor is growing increasingly sour toward the EV company.

item.title: Former Meta integrity chief says new report reveals ‘disappointing’ ad fraud epidemic at the social-media giant
item.description: An internal audit warned of systemic corruption, yet Meta expanded Chinese ad partnerships that generated billions—much of it tied to fraud.

item.title: Rivian CEO says the EV maker’s new large driving model will one day allow for fully autonomous driving—and maybe a spot in the robotaxi race
item.description: “Our initial focus will be on personally owned vehicles," RJ Scaringe said. But "this also enables us to pursue opportunities in the rideshare space."

item.title: Only 10 Percent of Workers Use AI Daily. Getting Higher Adoption Depends on Leaders
item.description: A new survey finds that most workers are still tepid with their AI usage.

item.title: ‘We are now firmly back in a good is bad/bad is good regime’: Weak job data may lead to more rate cuts and boost stocks, Morgan Stanley economist says
item.description: Morgan Stanley’s top strategist Michael Wilson noted the labor market, more so than inflation, has become a crucial factor in determining future monet...
